page.title: 11Around Barkby.
page.content:
Barkby Hall stands near the church, with pasture and trees around it. A brook wanders though the fields past Barkby. Many footbridges cross the brook and a footpath goes along one side. Many large trees grow near it and wild plants grow around them.
All round the village are farmers' fields with wheat, beans and other crops growing in them. Other fields are used for cattle. A few nurseries have fruit trees and bushes in them.
Barkby and Barkby Thorpe have not yet been swallowed by Leicester. No main road, river or railway passes them. There is still enough room to have a large field set aside for cricket in the summer.
